item.title: Kathy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kathy add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "I am nothing special, of this I am sure. I am a common man with common thoughts and I've led a common life. There are no monuments dedicated to me and my name will soon be forgotten, but I've loved another with all my heart and soul, and to me, this has always been enough.." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "I finally understood what true love meant...love meant that you care for another person's happiness more than your own, no matter how painful the choices you face might be." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "When you're struggling with something, look at all the people around you and realize that every single person you see is struggling with something, and to them, it's just as hard as what you're going through." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Kathy add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "Sometimes you have to be apart from people you love, but that doesn't make you love them any less. Sometimes you love them more." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn't be filled?" -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Jaycee Dugard
item.description: "I don't believe in hate. To me it wastes too much time. People who hate waste so much of their life hating that they miss out on all the other stuff out here." -- Jaycee Dugard

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Geraldine Brooks
item.description: "A book is more than the sum of its materials. It is an artifact of the human mind and hand." -- Geraldine Brooks

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Mary Higgins Clark
item.description: "It's funny how, even long after you've accepted the grief of losing someone you love and truly have gotten on with your life, every once in a while something comes up that plays "gotcha," and for a moment or tow the car tissue seperates and the wound is raw again." -- Mary Higgins Clark

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once there was a tree, and she loved a little boy." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "Illness especially, may be a blessed forerunner of the individual’s conversion. Not only does it prevent him from realizing his desires; it even reduces his capacity for sin, his opportunities for vice. In that enforced detachment from evil, which is a Mercy of God, he has time to search himself, to appraise his life, to interpret it in terms of larger reality. He considers God, and, at that moment, there is a sense of duality, a confronting of personality with Divinity, a comparison of the facts of his life with the ideal from which he fell. The soul is forced to look inside itself, to inquire whether there is more peace in this suffering than in sinning. Once a sick man, in his passivity, begins to ask, “What is the purpose of my life? Why am I here?” the crisis has already begun. Conversion becomes possible the very moment a man ceases to blame God or life and begins to blame himself; by doing so, he becomes able to distinguish between his sinful barnacles and the ship of his soul. A crack has appeared in the armor of his egotism; now the sunlight of God’s grace can pour in. But until that happens, catastrophes can teach us nothing but despair." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "Strong passions are the precious raw material of sanctity. Individuals that have carried their sinning to extremes should not despair or say, “I am too great a sinner to change,” or “God would not want me.” God will take anyone who is willing to love, not with an occasional gesture, but with a “passionless passion,” a “wild tranquility.” A sinner, unrepentant, cannot love God, any more that a man on dry land can swim; but as soon as he takes his errant energies to God and asks for their redirection, he will become happy, as he was never happy before. It is not the wrong things one has already done which keep one from God; it is the present persistence in that wrong." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "America, it is said, is suffering from intolerance — it is not. It is suffering from tolerance. Tolerance of right and wrong, truth and error, virtue and evil, Christ and chaos. Our country is not nearly so overrun with the bigoted as it is overrun with the broadminded." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "Love is a mutual self-giving which ends in self-recovery." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "A woman gets angry when a man denies his faults, because she knew them all along. His lying mocks her affection; it is the deceit that angers her more than the faults." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton Sheen
item.description: "Any book which inspires us to lead a better life is a good book." -- Fulton Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "Too many people get credit for being good, when they are only being passive. They are too often praised for being broadminded when they are so broadminded they can never make up their minds about anything." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "You must remember to love people and use things, rather than to love things and use people." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "Criticism of others is thus an oblique form of self-commendation. We think we make the picture hang straight on our wall by telling our neighbors that all his pictures are crooked." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Fulton J. Sheen
item.description: "Sometimes the only way the good Lord can get into some hearts is to break them." -- Fulton J. Sheen

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Unable are the loved to die. For love is immortality." -- Emily Dickinson
